Reviews.Title: “Love Jardin De Recoletos! Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lesnsal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and the location is just perfect. Away from the touristic crowds of mayor and sol and close to the shopping area in Salamanca Area. The location is very accesible to any mode of transport and we just hail a taxi bec its quite cheap considering its 3 of us. Staff was just as good as it is. Eduardo, Manuel and the rest of the guys in the front desk was just AMAZING. They help you in veryway they can. They speak excellent english and replies to your emails quickly. The room is large for eu standard and we had a free mini bar and some microwave and stove. It was very clean. From the hotel to atocha train station, we only paid around 4.30-5.00 eu. From hotel to Palacio real, it was around 12 eu. From hotel to chamartin, it was around 20 eu at around 7:00am. From the hotel, you can walk for a minute and you''ll be in shopping haven. Its around 500 meters to el cortes ingles and around 1km to the branded stores like LV, hermes, dior and etc. Prada and Loewe is just a brisk 3-4 minute walk. Breakfast was ok for 9.95 eu. You can tell the waitress if you want eggs and bacon and they will cook it for you. They have a section for those who want milk, cookies or pastries low in sugar.Different kinds if cheese, hams, cereal, yogurt and they had this multi grain bread that i really love. Thanks Jardin!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lavender007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jardin de Recoletos for 5 nights in April '12. It is very central, 5 mins walk to Retiro Park and approx 20mins walk to the main shopping and restaurant areas. Room was large and very clean. It had a small kitchen area with a fridge which was handy.The large window opens on to a small balcony so it's easy to cool the room down. The street below is narrow and quiet. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our only problem was that the hotel didn't seem to be very well soundproofed. From 6am onwards we could hear talking and moving about from the other rooms. This is possibly partly due to the floors being tiled as opposed to carpeted. Overall though, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shar0n
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with 2 friends and we had a lovely time. Easy to find - we got the bus from airport to Plaza de Cibeles and it was no more than a 10 minute walk to the hotel. The guy on reception was very pleasant and helpful and check-in was quick and efficient. Rooms were lovely and the complimentary soft drinks and water a nice touch. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but ate in the Mallorca patisserie round the corner in Calle Serrano. The only negative comment I could make is that the walls in the room are paper thin. I was awakened at 4am by the couple in the next room in the throes of passion!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and flawless”
Reviews.Author: BaronVonH
Reviews.Content: For every traveler, except those who need maximum luxury or maximum buzz right around the hotel, Jardin de Recoletos is an ideal choice. Because we were going to be jet-lagged and in need of much rest, we opted for this hotel in the relatively quiet Retiro/Salamanca barrio, instead of being smack in the middle of Old Madrid. It was a great choice. The rooms are very good-sized for a European capital city. All the room faciltiies (bathroom, kitchenette) were spotlessly clean. The decor is not "current", but the built-ins and fixtures were very good quality and in good shape. All rooms have a view of the street (super quiet) or the garden. No "light well" views to worry about. Beds are among th emost firm that I have slept on in Spain. Shower pressure was very good, and the shower head placement will please taller men. The breakfasts were the best that we had on our trip, and the breakfast room was light-filled, with a garden view. Much more appealing than the typical basement breakfast room. The neighborhood is quiet and upscale -- very safe feeling. There are a dozen restaurants within two blocks, and most of the attractions of Madrid (including the art museums) are within a 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJTGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for weekend 23-25 March with 2 friends. Super hotel in good area (a very short walk to Retiro park) with spacious, clean rooms. Hotel reception staff very helpful and friendly. Had a triple room. There is a small kitchen area with a fridge stocked with small amount of complimentary soft drinks, very much appreciated! No kettle tho! Make sure you visit the Mallorca cafe/ patisserie on closeby Calle de Serrano for brunch! Delicious and worth every penny! Madrid is a fabulous city and Hotel Jardin de Recoletes is a very good base to use! Was €300 for 2 nights for the room (exc breakfast) which was good value for the standard of accomm and the hotel's location. Would def use again if revisiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little boutique near Retiro park and all Madrid attractions”
Reviews.Author: Gaurangd12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with young child with us. Rooms were very spacious for European or any standards, very good and helpful staff. We requested for early check-in and we got it. Decent breakfast spread with pastries, juices, cheeses, cold cuts and hot breakfast items. All attractions of Madrid like Retiro Park, Prado Museo, Reine Sofia Museo, Plaza Mayor are all within walking distance and it's great fun to explore. Hotel is located in shopping district with loads of nice little boutiques and fashion houses galore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip last minute & had a fabulous time. The hotel is in a lovely area of Madrid, just far away enough from the city centre. Lovely shops and cafes within walking distance (recommend the Mallorca cafe for breakfast, just around the corner). The metro & main bus stops are a short walk away to get into the city or to ride the 'hop-on'hop-off' tour bus. The hotel staff (Samuel in particular!) were very friendly and incredibly helpful & the hotel was clean, room spacious and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: Tessa_TA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in mid-January 2012. The hotel fully lived up to my expectations: efficient, clean and very well located. In fact, couldn’t find anything to complain about. Breakfast was well varied, coffee delicious. Free wi-fi in the room was a nice and unexpected bonus (get login info from the reception). The bed was very firm (though this doesn’t have to be a disadvantage). Rooms were cleaned promptly every morning. Drinks (water and Schweps) in the minibar were replaced free of charge every day. The bathroom had all the amenities a traveler can possibly need. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk (downhill) to the airport bus stop at Plaza de Cibeles. The Retiro metro station is 3 minutes away, and so is the Retiro park (a must on a sunny morning!) Reception staff were courteous (although quite formal, which, again, is not a disadvantage in my view). Some noise from the other rooms could be heard though I have yet to stay in a fully sound-proof hotel and the noise does not outweigh the positives. Overall, if I were to stay in Madrid again, I would most likely book Jardin (with the same garden view)!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel does it job”
Reviews.Author: TravelMountain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Jardin de Recoletos mid December 2011 due to Tripadvisor contributions. Every single person is amazed by this hotel. Well, I am not amazed. I am happy with the hotel. Yes, it is a quiet hotel which is great. I am unimpressed with the staff. They did what they needed to do. check in and give keys. I work in the hospitality industry and I know what a smile can do. Anyway, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel - quiet and a good value”
Reviews.Author: FlCracker
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our 2 night stay. The room was very large and exceptionally clean. We had a garden room and there was no street/city noise, however, there was a bit from the adjoining rooms. The staff were wonderful. The free minibar was a nice touch and having a kitchenette was great. We plan to make this our new home base in Madrid. I would consider this hotel perfect - if only it was all non-smoking...

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: MMMColumbus_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We were in Madrid for four days on our way to a conference in Almeria and found this hotel on Trip Advisor. It was everything I want in an urban hotel, Quiet, in fact amazingly so because our room (302) looked out on the hotel garden plus there was practically no street noise anywhere in the hotel since it is on a one way side street. Our room was large with a kitchette. Great service with a bar and restaurant plus many good restaurants are within a 10 minute walk. The Metro is only steps away so we took the train in from the airport which saved us 40 Euros. It is 5 minutes from Independence Plaza and the Retiro Park and 10-15 minutes from the Prado, the major plazas and many other rmain attractions. Madrid is such a walkable city! Our colleagues who live in Madrid had not heard of it and asked how we found it. When we said Trip Advisor, they went online to check out the site. Love teaching the locals about a good hotel in their city!

Reviews.Title: “A nice, quiet four star hotel in Madrid at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: hb01659_10
Reviews.Content: The room was quite large and well-equipped. It even included a small kitchen with a fridge, microwave oven and induction cooking set. LCD TV set. Bed was quite large and comfortable. Relatively quiet room for Madrid. Nice location in the famous Salamanca area. Close to metro station "Retiro" (5 minutes walk), museum Le Prado, Parque del Retiro, etc.. Breaksfast was rather varied and very reasonable, fresh fruits, very good spanish ham, cheese, eggs, croissants, yoghurts, ... Coffee and/or tea were served only once yet (no self-service with that respect). Room service works very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DriCa_SP
Reviews.Content: We had 2 great rooms at their top floor and we were very glad with our choice. The rooms are big, have a small kitchen and we had a beautiful terrace where we could seat and enjoy the end of the evening. The location was great and we had everything nearby, restaurants, shops, parks, and taxis are easy to find if you want to go downtown... Breakfast is served in a beautiful outdoor terrace and it is a pleasure to start a summer day in their restaurant, not for the choices in food that are kind of average, but it is worth for the peacefull surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and great location”
Reviews.Author: BackAtLast
Reviews.Content: I had to check the room rate once we checked in as this hotel was way above our expectations for the money. Friendly and helpful staff, excellent room with kitchenette and lounge furniture, and a wonderful courtyard where we ate a very good meal. The location is in the modern shopping part of Madrid, some distance from the old town but very close to the gardens which include the Crystal palace etc. Had no trouble finding very good food wherever we went, there are 10 or more good restaurants within 10 minutes walk of the hotel. Would certainly stay again, no hesitation. Madrid is a great city..

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at Jardin”
Reviews.Author: doc111872
Reviews.Content: The terrrace was great for breakfast. The room was clean and very comfortable, and I loved the use of the kitchenette. The only issue I had was I could hear what I think was the elevator until about 3 in the morning (at first I thought there was construction going on in the hotel) I could even hear it over the sound of the tv. Other than that I had a great stay at Jardin de Recoletos.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: firtreecott
Reviews.Content: We had wanted a quiet hotel close to the centre. This hotel was perfect for us. The room was lovely and everything worked. We did not want to pay the €14 breakfast charge, but there is an excellent cafe a short walk away on the Plaza de Independencia where breakfast is around €4. It was nice to have a small bar on site for the pre dinner drinks. For high grade shopping, it is perfectly placed for the shops all along and behind Calle Serrano. You can catch the tour buses outside the park gate on the nearby Plaza de Independencia. Be patient and be prepared to start your journey downstairs. You can then go upstairs when someone gets off. Serrano metro is two blocks away. The metro is very easy to use with a single fare that covers any length of trip and changes. A book of 10 works out much cheaper. The receptionists were all extremely helpful with luggage, arranging taxis etc. It is a bit expensive, but I think you will struggle to get a quiet, nice hotel so close to the centre. I would definitely use this hotel again. Some taxi drivers did not recognise the street name. They needed to enter Santibanes in their SatNav rather than Gil de San..... Luckily, I had taken a print of the Google map which helped them to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Value 10/10”
Reviews.Author: Sarah N
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. Our rooms were huge, included a kitchenette and a free mini bar with soft drinks. The staff were very helpful and polite, loved the breakfast and had an evening meal which was delicious! Great location, very quiet but not far from all the main areas. Probably a nice 25 min walk to the Mayor Plaza. The city tour bus picks up from just outside. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay there again. It was great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Barrio Salamanca.”
Reviews.Author: Cibeles33
Reviews.Content: I stay in Madrid regularly and have tried many options. El Jardin de Recoletos is without doubt the best value for money in my favourite area of town. Room is somewhat quirky (mini kitchen hidden behind wardrobe doors - why?) but very comfortable and well equipped. Good breakfast - location, food and service and all staff were friendly and helpful. For quality, I would stay at the Gran Fenix but it isn't nearly half as good value as the Jardin. Well done VP!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat in the city”
Reviews.Author: Lynn06883
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect place to stay in Madrid. It is in a quiet section of town, which made it a nice place to return to each night after a full day of sightseeing. It is a very short walk to the metro, so all of Madrid is easy to access. With that said, you can easily walk to the Plaza Mayor or the Prado within 15 minutes. The room was spotless and spacious. We had a lovely view of the garden restaurant below. We definitely appreciated the free sodas and waters in the fridge in the room, and the free WIFI. The people at the front desk could not have been more pleasant or helpful. I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo!”
Reviews.Author: TrottaGnam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in early July. There were 6 of us occupying two rooms. The hotel appears like nothing special from the street. But, inside it's much nicer. Rooms are very pleasant: spacious, nicely furnished and quiet. All amenities are present and housekeeping as well as room service are good. Nice little tidbit was that all softdrinks in the minibar were included in the price. After many hot/humid hours in the city, it's nice to sip some cold ones in the room not worrying about overpriced minibar drinks :-) We didn't try the garden restaurant but the setting is lovely. (We sat there one evening and they have mist sprayers that take away from the summer heat). Folks at the reception desk were very professional, friendly and helpful. They also helped with airport transportation which worked out very nicely: a large van for EUR 45 that was both prompt and efficient. We would definitely stay here again. Prado and Parco de Retiro are easy walking distance from the hotel. Also, the fun part of the city is literally next door.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yaminez
Reviews.Content: ok im rather late posting this review sorry guys .We travelled to Madrid in november 2010 and booked to stay at jardin for 3 nights .From the moment we arrived the staff were very friendly especially as our Spanish is poor at best .The room was large with a settee and a kitchen area too ,which would be great if you were travelling with a young family .We ate in the restaurant on two occasions and the food was good as was the breakfast too.The outside seating area looked lovely but the weather was a little chilly while we were there so we didnt get to use it , I bet it is wonderful in summer .The hotel is located down a side street and so is very quiet .Near by are the boutique shops of calle de serrano, very swish . Just a few minutes walk away is the famous Retiro Park which is just stunning .I saw red squirrels and cats, lots of cats .There is so much to see in the park that you will not see it all if you are there for only a few days .We used the metro a lot and had no problems at all.It was clean well run and took us just where we wanted to go .One thing to look out for is roundabouts because in Madrid they beautiful with wonderful architecture .Also look out for the Parakeets ,very beautiful. We flew with Easy Jet and I was a little nervous but i have to say I could not fault them .All in all a wonderful city break .All i need now is to improve my spanish and get back over there.I would not hesitate to stay at Jardin again ,clean, great staff, wonderful quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in quiet part of the city”
Reviews.Author: SeaStars
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and it was just as quiet and comfortable as we remembered. This is an apartment hotel with spacious rooms consisting of 1 double bed or two twin beds, and a sofa bed. The large bathroom included a shower/tub combo. The room also has a large armoire, desk and kitchenette. The kitchenette hides behind a sliding mirrored door and is comprised of a small sink, mini fridege, stove burner and microwave. The mini fridge is stocked with complimentary soft drinks and water during your stay. Upon our arrival we requested diet Coke instead of regular and the cans were switched by the time we returned from sightseeing. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet and it was one of the best breakfasts we had during our trip to Spain. The buffet includes a delicious Spanish tortilla, spanish cold cuts, cheeses, fresh fruit and juices, as well as pastries and bread. It is well worth the extra money and highly recommended This hotel is located on a quiet side street in a very nice part of the city, near metro stops, fine shopping and El Retiro park.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: jlsterling226
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and loved. The rooms were very nice and quiet. Great neighborhood to walk around in. Expensive shopping but it was a lot better than the Las Huertas district. Conceirge was very friendly and helpful. I booked our room via booking.com about two days before we stayed there and got a nice rate for the neighborhood. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: jumbonav
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Madrid, I booked this hotel in order to try a neighborhood away from Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor and the Gran Via. I was not disappointed. The immediate neighborhood is quiet/residential on a pedestrian only (except for the occasional cab) street. The hotel staff was warm, friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, had a nice patio, mini-kitchen, very good WiFi, and was nicely appointed. It's a short 5 minute walk to both the Metro station near Retiro Park and Plaza Colon. I did not use the restaurant but it is in a nice outdoor courtyard at the rear of the restaurant. It appeared to be a very nice place for a romantic dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, especially for three people”
Reviews.Author: pgo
Reviews.Content: You don't often find a hotel with good accommodations for three adults. I was traveling with my two sons, and this hotel was a perfect fit. We even used the small kitchen to make a meal for under 10 Euros; doing the shopping was an enjoyable introduction to Spanish living. The staff was unfalilingly polite and helpful. Breakfast was very good, although the choices were limited during the last hour. Location was superb. Be sure to look into the new Express Aeropuerto bus that picks up and drops off in Plaza Cibeles, a five minute walk from the hotel. A quick and clean ride to or from the airport for just 2 euros. The side street on which the hotel is located is hard to find; use the "Museo de Arqueologica" as a landmark; it is only a block away from the entrance to Calle Gil de Santivades. Get the Corte Ingles map from the hotel desk, or you will go mad learning the changing names of the nearby streets.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, concerned staff, brilliant hotel for a visit to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PaulineMilngavie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic position. A quiet area within easy reach of the main attractions. The staff are really friendly and helpful. My son was unwell while we were staying in Madrid and the staff were very concerned and could not do enough for us. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel within walking distance of major museums, but in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Archieblackcat
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with spacious rooms and a lovely garden. The hotel is in a back street but in a central location so is quieter I imagine than some other central hotels. It was a little hard to find initially on the map but was worth the endurance. You can also walk to all of the major museums from the hotel. The hotel also offers a fantastic breakfast choice with very good vegetarian options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelady13
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel in Madrid. The location is fantastic, between Paseo la Castellana, Calle Serrano, Puerta de Alcala and Parque del Retiro. Is walking distance to the main attractions in the city. Besides the location, it's on a quite street has a good breakfast and best of all, a kitchenette. The room is comfortable, for European standards. It has a sofa sleeper, free WiFi, decent size bathroom and kitchenette. The staff is very friendly - both front desk and restaurant. Simple but has all the amenities you need on a business or leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Accommodation - shame about the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: RTST1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Jardin de Recoletos. Located in an up-market shopping area, within walking distance of Museums, Art Galleries and the Metro, we were delighted with the hotel. The staff could not have been more helpful. The breakfasts were excellent with every choice avilable and cans and bottled water were provided daily in the room. The twin room with its 4 foot comfortable beds was spacious, quiet and spotlessly clean. Fresh towels and bedding were provided each day and all the usual toiletries. However, having chosen poorly on the first night, we opted to eat in the Hotel restaurant for the second. A big mistake. The red wine arrived refrigerated. We returned it only to be given a second as cold as the first. Third time lucky. The first course of bean and fish stew was barely warm and served in an ice cold bowl. The 'loin of beef'' main course was burnt on the outside and uncooked inside. I could neither eat that nor the blood-soaked potatoes that accommpanied it. So, on the third night we made use of the cooking area in the room. This comprised of a counter, hob, microwave, coffee maker and basic equpment behind mirrored, sliding doors. Brilliant addition in our view. Future visitors should know that no tea and coffee etc. were provided and should bring their own at least for the first day as provisions' shops and supermarkets were not evident nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karendan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jardin de Recoletos on the recommendation of family, who had stayed there several months ago and raved about the accommodations. They were right!!!!! The hotel is in a fantastic location, within walking distance of many, many sights to see in Madrid (the Prado, the Reina Sophia, to mention just two). There are literally dozens of shops and restaurants less than 5 blocks from the hotel; there is great shopping, very high end boutiques in one direction and more funky shopping in the other. The hotel staff is top-notch; the breakfasts were perfect. The price is extremely reasonable, way less than what you would expect to pay for this quality of hotel in a big city. We cannot recommend it enough. We will definitely return to this hotel if we visit Madrid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Homey and well located”
Reviews.Author: monchef
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the property, and we made it our base for our trips outside Madrid. It is located on a small street of Calle Serrano in the Salmanca district, a quick brisk walk to Puerto de Sol, the museums and the shopping areas around Serrano. The rooms are large, with two beds, and an extra sofa bed if needed. Each comes with a hidden kitchen that has a microwave, a ceramic burner , fridge (with free water and sodas) and a coffee maker. Rooms are not plush, but very usable. Bathrooms come with simple amenities, and the daily breakfast was an ample spread of Spanish staples -- jamon, tortilla de patatas just to name a few choices. The staff was great -- Julio, Martin at the front desk, and the bar guys are always very atentive. I would recommend this place if you are not fussy. Wifi comes free, which is great as well. I recommend this for those with families.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER hotel, good location & super breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AnSophie
Reviews.Content: * very large rooms (even with kitchen behind sliding doors) * friendly staff * free wireless internet (after asking for your code at reception) * amazing breakfast with lots of choice, very fresh * large cosy terrace outside (patio), where you can have breakfast and dinner * since Madrid is a city you want to SEE, walking shouldn't be a problem: 5 min. walk to metro, 15 minutes to all important attractions. * a PLUS: you are in the centre, but in a quiet street, so no noise at night! * Super value for money * dinner at the hotel restaurant is ok, but there's many better and cheaper restaurants in an area at a 10min. walk

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveler1
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in Spain. We started out in Barcelona, and ended our trip going south, all the way to the southern most area of Tariffa. We spent two separate times at this hotel and enjoyed both visits. The staff was incredible, and the room was fit for a king. We spent our first visit there as a stopping point for a day trip to see Toledo (by train). When we were in Toledo, I sprained my ankle and when we returned late, the front desk manager asked if I was OK. I told him what had happened, and by the time we got to our room, someone had showed up with ice and aspirin for me. I would highly recommend this hotel, the only negative was the price, but considering Madrid, I'm sure it was fairly priced, especially being in the best part of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: Perrett-traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jarden de Recoletos 4 nights last fall and it was just right for us. The location is optimal for musuem/art lovers (especially the Prado and the Thyssen) and the access to the Parque de Retiro & several nearby Metro stations. The hotel had great rooms, nice staff and a wonderful garden. The breakfast buffett was also very good. Minor problems had little to do with the facility itself: there was some nearby construction that hurt the ambience of the area but the hotel itself was quite quiet and nearby tapas and dinner options were a bit limited. But all in all it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: DontLikeDowns
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for four nights. It was down a quiet side street off of a very busy main road with an awful lot of roadworks going on so were worried that it was going to be really noisy but were pleasantly surprised that it wasn't Initially arrived, reception was quite small and the receptionist was taking ages with the customer in front, when you are tired and have been travelling you just want to get to your room. Was feeling a bit irritated but then realised when he dealt with us that it was just his way and he was really helpful and thorough. In fact during our stay the reception staff were very helpful. The room was surprising, think I was expecting it to be small but it was lovely and spacious, smashing bed, and some attractive mirrored wardrobe (I thought) doors, could be pulled back to find a very well equipped and clean little kitchenette with microwave, big fridge, sink and 2 ring hob. We hadn't planned on cooking ourselves but did feel it was a bit of a bonus and could save you some money if you did want to. The room had a nice little seating area with a coffee table and settee. Small juliette balcony overlooking the garden but as we were only on the first floor we could see more of the ground floor extension. We noticed speakers set into the walls and realised we had a radio as well which was nice. It also had a small but well kept garden and it was pleasant to come back after sightseeing and enjoy a glass of wine, which was generally very cheap. The hotel is situated in a nice quite location that, although it's not right in the centre, we still didn't find it too far to walk to all of the attractions. We only got a taxi a couple of times and the metro a couple of times. We found the Metro on the whole safe but my boyfriend was pickpocketed on the Metro when we went back to the airport, luckily we managed to get the wallet back. We had our cases so obviously looked like tourists, but a word of advice would be to make sure you don't have your valuables where they can easily be spotted and taken and if people jostle you or block your way on an otherwise fairly empty train or station, check your belongings immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: DahlFamily
Reviews.Content: Jardin de Recoletos is situated in a quite street closed to one of the main streets. Ideally located to reach the center and the Madrid Vision (tour busses). It is about 5 min. walk from a nice and very large park with play-areas for children. We recommend the hotel to families with children. The rooms are spacious, have a small kitchen, refigorator, small freezer (nice for Hägen Dazs!). We made our booking via booking.com and got a good deal on 110 euros pr. night incl. breakfast. There was very good and fast service at the hotel and the hotel has an outdoor terasse. It is in between buildings so it is mostly in the shade. There is a parking garage to the hotel for 17 Euros. Parking in the street is only for short-term parking. Only minuses, the free wireless network was unstable so we got a cable instead (which then worked fine).

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeloverBeith
Reviews.Content: I just went to Madrid for a weekend, it was my first time there and it surprized me how beautiful the city is. The hotel was conveniently located, the staff were very friendly and the breakfast was great. Madrid is a city I will definitely go again and so is this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but dull, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: anthonywblair
Reviews.Content: Perfectly pleasant hotel in the smart shopping / business district. Everything was fine and as it should be but it could have been anywhere. Breakfast worth getting up for. Rooms a decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Ziggy99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel in September 2006 on the recommendation of Spanish friends.We stayed in a standard room and were pleasantly suprised by the size which was very generous for this price bracket. The location of the hotel is good, near the park and walking distance from the centre of town. Our only slight disapointment was the breakfast which was OK but nothing to rave about. All in all a good choice for a short break and as we managed to get a good deal (100 Euros per night) we thought it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Jardin de Recoletos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jardin de Recoletos from April 16-April 20. We stayed in their superior suite which was an excellent choice. Our suite included a well-equipped kitchen, jacuzzi that was great after a full day of sightseeing, and a large terrace. The staff at Recoletos was friendly and helpful. The room rate included breakfast that was plentiful. The hotel is on a quiet street and convenient to everything. I highly recommend Recoletos and would definitely stay there again!
